meanings.definition: A place where wine is made.
meanings.sent1: The wineries in this region produce delicious wines.
meanings.sent2: We visited several wineries during our wine tasting tour.
meanings.sent3: The wineries were so busy that the grapes had to wait their turn to become wine.
meanings.sent4: The wineries stood like ancient temples dedicated to the art of winemaking.
meanings.sent5: The wineries hummed with the sweet scent of fermenting grapes.

meanings.sent1: She decided to start her own wineries and become a winemaker.
meanings.sent2: The wineries in this area have been successful for many years.
meanings.sent3: The wineries had a sale on barrels, so they were really rolling in the business.
meanings.sent4: The wineries of this town were the heart of the wine industry.
meanings.sent5: In the wineries, the business of wine was always bustling.

meanings.sent1: The wineries require skilled workers to ensure the wine is made perfectly.
meanings.sent2: Learning about the wineries' process of wine production was fascinating.
meanings.sent3: The wineries celebrated the end of a successful year of wine production.
meanings.sent4: In the wineries, the magic of turning grapes into wine was a daily occurrence.
meanings.sent5: The wineries buzzed with activity as the wine production reached its peak.
